content: row do not turn to wrong side working yarn is at the left edge picking up and knitting stitches for i-cord edge 1 start in a square second from the bottom on an edge with slipped sts 2 hold the dpn double pointed needle in your right hand working yarn is at the left side 3 with rs of blanket facing insert the needle under two strands of the edge chain stitch wrap the yarn around the needle and pull it through to pick up and knit one stitch 6 sts on needle 4 slide the stitches to the opposite end of the needle the working yarn end is at the left side 5 pull gently on the working yarn bring it to the right edge and knit 4 k2tog through the back loops 6 you have worked 6 stitches the original 5 cast on stitches plus the picked-up stitch 7 pick up and knit one stitch from blanket edge 6 sts on needle 8 slide the stitches to the opposite end of the needle 9 *knit 4 k2tog tbl pick up and knit one stitch from blanket edge slide sts to opposite end of the needle repeat step 9 to one stitch from the corner note the i-cord edge should lay flat if you find the i-cord edge is too tight once or twice per square pick up and knit twice into the same stitch corner work twice into the stitch to the right of corner stitch work twice into the corner stitch and twice into the stitch to the left of the corner stitch the corner should lay flat if it doesn t undo and work additional sts into corner stitch finishing work the i-cord until the ending stitches butt up against the cast on stitches carefully remove the contrast yarn used for the provisional cast on place the live stitches on a 4mm or smaller needle use the kitchener stitch three needle bind-off or weave the live stitches together to join the edges weaving in yarn tails at the row ends weave the tails into the knitting and then run the yarn through the i-cord to hide and bury the end blocking the blanket would benefit from a gentle washing and blocking lay flat on a non-absorbent surface and shape into a square shape and secure the corners with rust- proof pins allow to dry completely 6 magic tiles blanket © brenda brayfield 2006 updated 2020 for personal use only square sizes for future projects 21
